metadata.name: User Discovery And Export Via Get-ADUser Cmdlet
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the Get-ADUser cmdlet to collect user information and output it to a file

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('get-aduser ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -filter *')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' > ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' | select ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('out-file')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('set-content')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('add-content'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of the Get-ADUser cmdlet to collect user information and output it to a file

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate admin scripts may use the same technique, it's better to exclude specific computers or users who execute these commands or scripts often References: http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2022/09/lazarus-three-rats.html, https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2022/10/18/defenders-beware-a-case-for-post-ransomware-investigations/
